title: BJP's 'secular' allies brush aside oppn pressure, vote in support of waqf bill

description: President Donald Trump announced new tariffs, imposing a 10% baseline tax on most imports, with increased rates for nations with trade surpluses. Notable exceptions include Canada and Mexico due to existing agreements. High tariffs target China, the EU, South Korea, Japan, and Taiwan, with a new 25% tariff on all foreign-made automobiles, sparking concerns of global retaliation.
title: Canada and Mexico missing from Trump's reciprocal tariff list. Here's why

description: The National Medical Commission is revising disability guidelines for medical course admissions to focus on candidates' performance abilities rather than disability percentages. This follows a Supreme Court directive and aims to outline essential medical competencies crucial for safe practice, provoking criticism over the composition of the reviewing committee.
title: NMC reviews disability norms to focus on what candidates can do

description: Supreme Court reprimanded the Telangana CM and assembly speaker over alleged MLA defections. The court asserted its power to enforce the anti-defection law, especially when the speaker delays disqualification decisions. The bench highlighted its role as a constitutional protector and warned against making a mockery of the 10th Schedule.
title: Not powerless against mockery of anti-defection law, SC tells Telangana

description: Routine health check-ups can save lives, as evidenced by 46-year-old Sheetal Thakur, whose early-detected breast cancer was treated successfully. Despite such benefits, only 1.3% of Indian women undergo mammography due to lack of awareness and unfounded radiation fears, hindering early cancer detection.
title: Only 1 in 100 women aged 45+ get screened for breast cancer: Study

description: Thousands protested in Ukhrul, Manipur against the Union government's decision to end the free movement regime (FMR) and build a barbed-wire fence along the India-Myanmar border. Tribal communities, like the Tangkhul Naga, voiced strong opposition, stressing that the move would sever familial ties and heighten tensions.
title: Rally in Manipur against Myanmar border fence

description: The Supreme Court commission investigating the March 14 fire at former Delhi High Court judge Yashwant Varma's residence has recorded statements from Delhi Police commissioner Sanjay Arora and other senior officers. Arora detailed that the storeroom with cash was kept locked and located near a CRPF guard room.
title: SC panel records top cop's statement on fire at judge's house

description: US President Donald Trump announced significant tariffs on imports, including a 34% tax on Chinese goods and 20% on the European Union. The move, aimed at reducing trade deficits and bolstering American manufacturing, has sparked concerns about potential global trade wars and rising consumer prices. Several US allies are considering retaliatory measures, which could impact diplomatic relations.
title: Trump announces reciprocal tariffs: Full list of countries impacted

description: ASAR Social Impact Advisors clarified that it received Rs 8 crore from USAID for services provided under a Clean Air Better Health project with CEEW. The company denied receiving any foreign direct investment and affirmed full compliance with legal requirements amid an ongoing investigation by authorities.
title: Was engaged to provide CEEW services for USAID task: ASAR

description: The Supreme Court addressed the increasing trend of rape cases filed on the grounds of false promises of marriage. While hearing a man's plea to quash rape charges by his fiancée, the bench remarked that relationship break-ups should not result in rape allegations. They decided to examine the arranged marriage situation in detail.
title: Break-up should not result in rape case: Supreme Court

description: Authorities in Haridwar are relocating all butcher shops outside municipal limits to improve sanitation and control stray dogs. Around 100 shops, mostly in Jwalapur and Jagjeetpur, will be affected. Validly licensed shops will move to a new site in Sarai village while illegal ones will be sealed. Residents have long complained about the poor hygiene of these shops.
title: Haridwar to be butcher-free, meat shops to exit city limits

description: Karnataka chief minister Siddaramaiah faces new legal challenges as the Enforcement Directorate (ED) contests a Lokayukta police report clearing him in the Muda site allotment case. ED claims significant evidence against Siddaramaiah and seeks the Special Court's intervention. Opposition allege bias in the Lokayukta's findings.
title: Siddaramaiah faces fresh Muda trouble as ED challenges Lokayukta report

description: Several officers in the commerce department in India are gearing up to assess the impact of US President Donald Trump's reciprocal tariffs on Indian exporters and businesses. A war room has been set up for this purpose, amid concerns about potential dents on margins and bargaining power shifts.
title: Trump tariff: Officials set for all-nighter to assess impact

description: US President Donald Trump announced new reciprocal tariffs to counter high duties charged on US goods by foreign countries. With tariffs on countries like China, India, and the EU, the move aims to rebalance trade.
title: Trump’s 26% 'discounted' tariff: Is India relatively insulated?

description: A two-year-old girl from Andhra Pradesh's Palnadu district has died of avian influenza (H5N1) after consuming raw chicken. This is the state's first documented human fatality from bird flu. Health officials have declared a high alert, urging caution and thorough cooking of poultry to prevent further incidents.
title: 2-year-old eats raw meat, dies of bird flu in Andhra Pradesh

description: The Deesa firecracker factory blast, which killed 21 people, was caused by the deliberate negligence of Khubchand Mohanani and his son Deepak, who instructed workers to keep the shutters closed to avoid detection. The explosion was triggered by the presence of aluminum powder used in the production of firecrackers.
title: Father-son duo held for Gujarat blast that killed 21

description: Donald Trump announced country-specific reciprocatory tariffs heralding the golden age of America. As he announced the tariffs, he said he did not impose the exact tariff that the countries charge on US products but has been kinder. Higher tariffs have been imposed on the worst offenders. The stock market took a hit in after-hours trading following President Trump's announcement of broad new tariffs.
title: 'Friend is worse than foe': Donald Trump's country-specific tariffs
Lok Sabha passes Waqf Bill 288-232 after marathon 12-hour debate

description: Over 300 development projects in Jammu & Kashmir received forest clearance, promoting infrastructure and economic growth. This includes road networks, water supply schemes, and 4G saturation. Necessary compensatory afforestation will be undertaken to maintain ecological balance.
title: Over 300 projects receive forest clearance in J&K for various projects

description: Pakistani soldiers violated the ceasefire along the Line of Control in Poonch, J&K. Indian troops responded effectively, maintaining control over the situation. This incident follows earlier breaches and highlights ongoing security concerns with 70 to 80 Pakistani terrorists currently active in the region.
title: Pakistan opens unprovoked fire, breaks truce along LoC in Poonch sector

description: US President Donald Trump announced a 26 per cent 'discounted' reciprocal tariff on India, stating that past charges were not entirely reciprocal. At a 'Make America Wealthy Again' event in the Rose Garden, Trump referred to Prime Minister Narendra Modi as a 'great friend' but criticized India for its unfair treatment of the US.
title: 'PM Modi great friend': Trump announces 26% 'discounted' tariff on India
Review Katchatheevu pact & retrieve it: TN House to Centre

description: DMK MP A Raja has urged party members to avoid Hindu religious symbols when wearing party attire, stating that it blurs the line between the DMK and RSS. This statement has provoked backlash from BJP leaders, who accuse him of undermining Hindu traditions. DMK asserts it's Raja’s personal view.
title: Shun tilaks at party events, says DMK MP A Raja, starts a row

description: A US national, Mykhailo Viktorvych Polyakov, was arrested for entering prohibited North Sentinel Island in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. He was remanded to custody with video evidence confirming his visit. Polyakov claimed to be a thrill seeker and had previously attempted similar actions, including making contact with isolated tribes.
title: With coconut & coke, American tried to befriend Sentinelese

description: Reports that Elon Musk will leave his role as a special government employee have been strongly denied by his supporters. President Donald Trump indicated that Musk's tenure at the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) might end soon, though Musk's significant contributions are still valued at the White House.
title: Elon Musk stepping down from DOGE? What Donald Trump said

description: Jos Buttler's explosive 73 off 39 balls led Gujarat Titans to an eight-wicket win over Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Supported by Sai Sudharsan’s 49, the Titans swiftly chased down 169 runs, concluding the game with 13 balls to spare. RCB struggled to establish momentum, with GT bowlers maintaining control throughout their innings.
title: IPL 2025: Blazing Buttler flattens RCB
Liberation Day or Aberration Day? World holds breath for Trump tariff rollout

description: Nintendo has confirmed the release of the Nintendo Switch 2 on June 5, featuring a 7.9-inch display, enhanced controls, and 4K output for TVs. New features include GameChat, GameShare, and a dedicated camera. Priced at $449.99, it will launch with games like Mario Kart World and enhanced GameCube classics.
title: Nintendo Switch 2 launch date confirmed: Price, specs and games revealed

description: Lok Sabha saw a heated exchange as Asaduddin Owaisi tore the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, calling it unconstitutional and an attack on Muslims. Owaisi's actions were criticized by BJP's Jagdambika Pal. Union Minister Amit Shah asserted that the bill aims to regulate Waqf properties and prevent their exploitation. The bill faces intense debate in Parliament.
title: Owaisi cites Gandhi, rips Waqf Bill copy; Jagdambika Pal counters

description: Maoists, impacted by continuous security operations, propose a ceasefire and peace talks. They allege government offenses including mass killings and sexual violence. The Chhattisgarh home minister insists these claims are false, calling for Maoists to initiate genuine talks without conditions, stressing the state's commitment to law enforcement.
title: Maoists seeking a ceasefire? Can't accept conditions: Government

description: Immigration lawyers suggest that Canadians should travel to the US with burner phones and not their actual phones because US customs officials can look through their mobile phones, check social media comments and download all data. The concept of privacy is completely different in the United States now, lawyer Heather Segal told CBC News.
title: Canadian lawyers suggest 'take a burner phone' for travel to US

description: Elon Musk recently posted an updated video of Tesla's Optimus robot showcasing its improved walking abilities on social media platform X. With production already initiated, Tesla plans to deploy a significant number of these robots by the end of the year and expects to have 10,000-12,000 units ready by 2025.
title: Elon Musk provides an update on Tesla's Optimus Robot: ‘There will be a…’

description: Nitish Kumar's support for the Waqf Amendment Bill in Lok Sabha marks a strategic shift in his political stance, potentially realigning votes in Bihar's upcoming assembly elections. Analysts suggest this move may help the NDA consolidate support, despite possible backlash from Muslim voters.
title: 'Fence sitters could ... ': Why Waqf politics may help NDA in Bihar

description: A senior aide of Bangladesh's interim government head Muhammad Yunus clarified that Muhammad Yunus' remark about India's seven northeastern states was made with honest intentions and misinterpreted. The statement stirred strong reactions in India. Bangladesh seeks a possible meeting between Yunus and PM Modi at the upcoming BIMSTEC Summit.
title: 'His remark on Northeast misinterpreted': Aide of Yunus

description: Heemal Vaid, an Indian-origin drug trafficker, has been sentenced to 18 years in prison for orchestrating the import and distribution of over 4 million pounds worth of cocaine and heroin. The NCA identified him through encrypted messages on EncroChat and revealed his extensive drug importation and money laundering activities.
title: Indian-origin drug kingpin jailed for 18 years in UK

description: During the RCB vs GT IPL 2025 match, Virat Kohli injured his finger while fielding. Despite the injury, Kohli continued playing but seemed uncomfortable. Mohammed Siraj led GT's attack, reducing RCB to 42/4 before a recovery led by Livingstone, Sharma, and David. Kohli’s injury could impact RCB’s struggling season. Fans await updates.
title: Injury scare! Virat Kohli hurts finger during RCB vs GT clash
Jaguar fighter aircraft crashes in Gujarat's Jamnagar, trainee pilot dead

description: A South American theft ring has targeted elite athletes, including NFL stars Patrick Mahomes and Travis Kelce, stealing over $2 million in luxury items. Seven suspects were indicted in Tampa, Florida, for orchestrating well-planned burglaries during athletes' absences. This case underscores the need for improved security measures for high-profile individuals.
title: NFL burglary: Patrick Mahomes, Travis Kelce among targets in $2M heist

description: Global stock markets fell sharply as investors awaited President Trump's imminent tariff announcement, fearing a potential trade war. The announcement, dubbed "Liberation Day," could impact both allies and adversaries. Stock indices across Europe and the US dropped, with significant losses in Frankfurt. Key concerns include new auto tariffs and their potential economic impact.
title: Stocks slide worldwide ahead of Trump's 'Liberation Day' as trade war fears mount

description: Donald Trump hinted that Elon Musk would soon go back to his business wrapping up DOGE, something that Musk already said. "He's got a big company to run ... At some point he's going to be going back," Trump reportedly said about Elon Musk. "He wants to. I'd keep him as long as I could keep him." Trump said agencies that worked with DOGE learned a lot and they should be able to handle the work.
title: Trump told inner circle Elon Musk will soon step back: Report

description: UPI users experienced widespread transaction failures across major apps like Paytm and Google Pay for the second time in two weeks. The outage peaked around 7.30 pm, affecting hundreds in fund transfers and payments. The National Payments Corporation of India did not acknowledge the outage, prompting user frustration on social media.
title: UPI down: Users say unable to send money through GPay, PhonePe, Paytm and other apps

description: Pakistan's Abrar Ahmed faced a fan's confrontation regarding his send-off to India's Shubman Gill during the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. The incident has gone viral on social media. During a second ODI against New Zealand, a female fan questioned Abrar's behavior. Pakistan's recent performance in ODIs has been disappointing, with a defeat against New Zealand.
title: Viral video: Fan confronts Pakistan's Abrar over Gill controversy

description: During the IPL 2025 match between RCB and GT, Liam Livingstone's bat unexpectedly flew out of his hands, amusing fans. RCB struggled initially, with top-order collapses. However, Livingstone's 54-run knock helped RCB reach 169/8. The flying bat moment became a viral sensation, adding a humorous twist to the tense game.
title: Watch: Bat in air; video goes viral during IPL clash

description: World Chess Champion D Gukesh and Viswanathan Anand were seen dancing to popular Bollywood songs at fellow Grandmaster Vidit Gujrathi’s wedding, showcasing a rarely seen fun side of the GMs. Gukesh will participate in the Paris Freestyle Chess Grand Slam, while being closely followed by Arjun Erigaisi in the FIDE chess rankings.
title: Watch: Gukesh, Anand dance to Bollywood beats in Vidit's wedding

description: Lucknow Super Giants owner Sanjiv Goenka encouraged his team to regroup after their eight-wicket loss to Punjab Kings in the 2025 IPL. Despite a strong partnership from Nicholas Pooran and Ayush Badoni, LSG only posted 171/7. Punjab Kings chased comfortably, led by Prabhsimran Singh's 69 and Shreyas Iyer's 50*. Punjab is now second, while LSG is sixth.
title: 'You're entitled to your disappointment': Goenka to LSG players

description: Finnish energy company Helen said Tuesday it had closed the country's last active coal-fired power plant, ushering in "the end of the era of coal" for the Nordic country. Meanwhile some companies in the Nordic country still use small amounts of coal for energy production.
title: Finland closes last coal-fired power plant

description: Ayesha Jhulka addresses past rumors linking her to co-stars like Nana Patekar and Mithun Chakraborty, calling them baseless. She emphasizes that friendships with male co-stars were mistaken for romances. She refutes claims of breaking up Nana-Manisha relationship and clarifies it was embarrassing to be associated romantically with older actors.
title: Ayesha Jhulka reveals she was attracted to Akshay Kumar

description: The BCCI has announced India's 2025 home fixtures featuring Test, ODI, and T20I series against West Indies and South Africa. The season begins with Tests against West Indies in October. South Africa's tour starting in November includes a historic Test in Guwahati, followed by ODIs and a five-match T20I series concluding in December.
title: BCCI announces India’s 2025 home fixtures: Full Schedule here

description: Elon Musk humorously shared an edited image of himself as Neo from The Matrix inside the CIA HQ, following his meeting with CIA officials. The post references his role in government efficiency efforts, portraying himself as a disruptor of bureaucratic norms.
title: Elon Musk turns his CIA visit into Matrix pill 'Dayquil and NYquil' meme

description: UFC has announced a major multi-year partnership with Meta, marking Meta as the UFC's first-ever Official Fan Technology Partner. This collaboration aims to integrate AI, virtual reality, and social media to enhance fan interaction and create innovative content and experiences for UFC fans.
title: 'Game changer': UFC Boss Dana White announces partnership with Meta

description: A heated debate occurred in the Lok Sabha over the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, with Congress criticising it as unconstitutional and BJP defending it as necessary to prevent misuse. The Bill focuses on stricter criteria for Waqf declarations and amendments meant to enhance regulation and prevent illegal occupancy and misuse of Waqf lands, which are significant in India.
title: In 10 big numbers - Waqf and its properties in India

description: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav was discharged from Paras Hospital in Bihar and will now head to AIIMS Delhi for further treatment. His son, Tejaswi Yadav, confirmed that Lalu's current health is stable but his blood pressure and sugar levels have been fluctuating. Party leader Bhai Virendra assured that there's no need to worry.
title: Lalu Yadav discharged from Bihar Hosp, to head to AIIMS Delhi as health declines

description: 1983 World Cup winner Madan Lal urged for less pressure on cricketers following LSG owner Sanjiv Goenka's conversation with Rishabh Pant after their IPL 2025 defeat to PBKS. This incident follows a confrontation with KL Rahul last year. Pant admitted his team was short of 25 runs on the track.
title: 'Let them play freely': 1983 World Cup winner to Goenka on Pant chats

description: Billionaire Elon Musk made waves at a Wisconsin rally by wearing a Cheesehead, honoring the state's dairy farmers and Green Bay Packers fans. The event was notable for Musk’s controversial $1 million checks to voters, sparking legal scrutiny. Green Bay Packers legend Brett Favre humorously acknowledged Musk's gesture. Musk's presence emphasized his growing influence in political spheres.
title: Musk’s cheesehead moment in Wisconsin rally gets reaction from Brett Favre

description: The 2025 NFL Draft is set for April 24-26 at Lambeau Field, marking Green Bay's first time hosting the event. The draft, featuring 257 players, is crucial for teams to address their needs before the new season. The NFL Draft Experience in Green Bay offers free entry with various activities for fans.
title: NFL Draft Date 2025: Full Schedule, time, draft order & how to watch

description: Dr. Poonam Gupta has been appointed as the new Deputy Governor of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) for a three-year term, making her the first woman to hold this position in over a decade. With an illustrious career spanning the World Bank, IMF, and NCAER, Gupta brings extensive experience in economic policy and research. Her role will focus on monetary policy, financial markets, and inflation management, guiding the RBI through economic challenges and growth opportunities.
title: Poonam Gupta appointed RBI deputy governor: Education, career & new role
Russian woman who encouraged husband to rape Ukrainian women sentenced in Absentia
Shah recalls 2013 Lalu statement, says PM fulfilled his wish on Waqf law

description: Gujarat Titans' captain Shubman Gill chose to field first against Royal Challengers Bengaluru in their IPL match, citing favorable conditions and the need to reduce errors. Gujarat made one change with Arshad Khan replacing Kagiso Rabada. Rajat Patidar of RCB also preferred to bowl first but stuck with the same playing XI.
title: Shubman Gill reveals reason for Kagiso Rabada's absence vs RCB

description: A coup is seemingly underway in Mumbai cricket as Yashasvi Jaiswal seeks a No Objection Certificate and Suryakumar Yadav may follow him to Goa. The Goa Cricket Association is in talks with various players as they join the Ranji Trophy Elite Group. Discussions involve Hyderabad captain Tilak Varma too. Mumbai Cricket Association is holding meetings about these developments.
title: Suryakumar Yadav set to follow Yashasvi from Mumbai to Goa?

description: Tesla experienced a 13% decline in sales in the first quarter of 2025, with global deliveries dropping to 336,681 units. The decrease is due to an aging vehicle line-up, growing competition, and backlash from CEO Elon Musk's political stance. Incentives offered were insufficient to meet analysts' expectations of 408,000 deliveries.
title: Tesla sales dips 13% in Q1 as Musk's controversies weigh on demand

description: Republican candidates won two by-elections in Florida, but a Trump and Musk-backed judge lost in the Wisconsin Supreme Court race. The Florida wins give Republicans a slight edge in the House, though with narrower margins. In Wisconsin, liberal Judge Susan Crawford's victory maintains a liberal majority, countering Musk's significant campaign efforts.
title: Trump candidates win 2 bypolls but Dems clawing back
'Ultimately Trump's decision': Aides disagree on 20% Trump tariff till final hours

description: Muslim leaders and organizations object to the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, asserting it threatens the autonomy of Waqf properties dedicated for religious and charitable purposes. They claim the Bill aims to seize such lands and hampers Muslim religious liberties, labeling it as deceptive and unconstitutional.
title: Waqf Amendment Bill: Why Muslims are opposing it

description: After an IPL clash against Mumbai Indians, Rinku Singh humorously asked for a bat from Rohit Sharma. Tilak Varma teased him for this. Rinku has previously requested bats from Virat Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav. MI defeated KKR by eight wickets with a strong performance. Rinku’s interactions added a lighthearted moment to the game.
title: Watch: Rinku brutally trolled for asking Rohit Sharma's bat

description: President Donald Trump has made reciprocal tariffs a cornerstone of his trade policy, framing them as part of his broader “America First” agenda. On April 2, 2025, Trump officially unveiled his reciprocal tariff plan, calling it a necessary step to combat what he describes as decades of unfair trade practices by foreign nations. He declared the day “Liberation Day for American Trade,” signaling his administration’s commitment to leveling the playing field for U.S. businesses.
title: What are reciprocal tariffs and how is Donald Trump using them?

description: Elon Musk’s involvement in this race was far from incidental. As a key figure in President Donald Trump’s administration and leader of the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), Musk has become increasingly active in shaping political outcomes. DOGE has drawn significant attention for its aggressive cost-cutting measures across federal agencies, making Musk a polarizing figure in American politics.
title: Why Wisconsin Supreme Court loss was personal for Elon Musk

description: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Abhishek Bachchan dismissed recent rumors with their appearance at a family wedding, where Aishwarya and their daughter Aaradhya's twinning outfits stole the show. The couple's Bollywood magic was highlighted by a 'Kajra Re' dance performance with Aaradhya. On the work front, Aishwarya and Abhishek have exciting upcoming projects.
title: Aishwarya and Aaradhya Bachchan set stylish mother-daughter fashion goals

description: Starting April 1, 2025, changes in income tax slabs, UPI rules, and TDS thresholds will take effect. The highest tax rate of 30% applies to income above Rs 24 lakh. TDS thresholds for interest income have been increased. The Unified Pension Scheme begins and existing small savings scheme rates remain unchanged.
title: 6 financial changes from April 1 you should know

description: A Delhi Court dismissed Medha Patkar's appeal against her 2001 defamation conviction. The court upheld the sentencing of five months imprisonment and a Rs. 10 lakh fine for defaming V K Saxena. Patkar is required to appear in person for sentencing on April 8.
title: Delhi court rejects Medha Patkar's appeal against conviction in defamation case

description: The Republican-backed candidate lost a Wisconsin Supreme Court seat to Democrat Susan Crawford, despite significant financial support from Elon Musk. Meanwhile, in Florida, Republicans retained two critical US House seats, marking the first major elections since Trump took office in January.
title: Democrats call Wisconsin Supreme Court election win as Elon Musk's defeat

description: The devastating 7.7-magnitude earthquake on March 28, 2025, left thousands dead and massive destruction in Myanmar, particularly hitting Mandalay hard. High-resolution satellite images from ISRO showcased key damaged areas, aiding in relief efforts. International aid, including from India, is supporting rescue and recovery operations as the nation works to rebuild.
title: Earthquake hits Myanmar: Isro reveals before and after satellite images

description: Car manufacturers in India have increased prices due to rising input costs and inflation. Maruti Suzuki leads with up to a 4% hike. Other brands like Tata Motors, Mahindra, and Hyundai have also raised prices up to 3%. Despite this, dealers are offering discounts on entry-level models to boost sales in a challenging market.
title: From Maruti to Mahindra, prices see hike starting April 1: Find out new prices

description: Poonam Gupta, Director General of NCAER, has been appointed as Deputy Governor of the RBI for a three-year term. The position was vacant since January after M.D. Patra's tenure ended. Gupta brings extensive experience in economic policy, having worked at the IMF and World Bank, and holding academic roles at prestigious institutions.
title: Government appoints economist Poonam Gupta as RBI Deputy Governor

description: Tesla experienced a surge in sales in China in March 2025, with the Model Y becoming the top-selling vehicle in the country. The revamped Model 3 also performed well, securing its position among the top battery electric vehicles. Additionally, Tesla’s vehicle insurance registrations saw a significant increase during the final week of March.
title: Happy Elon Musk makes a Tesla announcement for China
'Haste haste jawab dunga': Akhilesh's BJP chief taunt & Shah's reply - Watch

description: Various spiritual leaders have been embroiled in significant controversies leading to legal actions and imprisonment. Notable cases include Bajinder Singh convicted for sexual assault, Rampal sentenced to life imprisonment, Gurmeet Ram Rahim serving for rape and murder, and Jalebi Baba found guilty of raping and blackmailing over 100 women.
title: How self-styled spiritual leaders threaten law and order

description: Police carried out a lathi charge on University of Hyderabad students and faculty protesting the government's decision to auction 400-acre land. Students and teachers demanded transparency in land-related documents and the removal of police and excavators, alleging betrayal by the varsity administration.
title: Hyderabad University: Police resort to lathi charge as students, faculty protest

description: Israel is intensifying its military operations in Gaza to reclaim significant areas and enhance security zones. This comes in response to ongoing conflict with Hamas. Israeli defence minister Katz emphasized the objective of eliminating terrorist threats and stressed the evacuation of civilians from affected regions.
title: Israel to seize 'large areas' of Gaza, military vows to 'crush and clean terrorists'

description: Nilamben Parikh, Mahatma Gandhi's great-granddaughter, passed away peacefully at 92. Known for her dedication to tribal women through her organisation Dakshinapatha, she followed Gandhian principles throughout her life. Parikh was also an author, writing about the complex relationship between Gandhi and his son Harilal. Her passing marks a significant loss to Indian history.
title: Mahatma Gandhi's great-granddaughter, Nilamben Parikh, dies at 92

description: Microsoft's environmental goals have become significantly more challenging due to its substantial investment in AI, with $80 billion allocated to data centers. Despite the increased difficulty, the company is intensifying its sustainability efforts and remains confident in achieving carbon negativity by 2030 through advanced technologies and AI.
title: Microsoft president shares update on 2030 goals: 'It was all on track & then…'

description: Nicholas Pooran is leading with an impressive strike rate and six count, making IPL 2024 a high-scoring season. Kagiso Rabada discusses the challenges for bowlers, the Impact Player rule, and shares his experience with coach Ashish Nehra and the upcoming WTC final.
title: Rabada EXCLUSIVE: 'Even a No. 10 can hit a six... there's no real mystery'

description: Rishabh Pant's lackluster performance both as a batsman and captain is putting Lucknow Super Giants under scrutiny in IPL 2025, following two losses in three matches. Former cricketer Harbhajan Singh suggests that LSG urgently find a solution to bolster their chances and address Pant's struggle. LSG were restricted to 171/7, thanks to Arshdeep Singh's three-wicket burst, and their bowlers failed to stop Punjab Kings batters during the chase. Punjab Kings reached the target with ease in just 16.2 overs.
title: 'Rishabh Pant has been a big shock, LSG have to ... '

description: Rohit Sharma discusses his evolved role within Mumbai Indians from middle-order batter and captain to opening batsman. Despite changes, his focus remains on winning games and trophies for MI. He highlighted the inclusion of new players like Trent Boult and Mitchell Santner bringing experience, aiming to win the IPL trophy.
title: Rohit Sharma breaks silence: 'I was the captain, now I’m not'

description: Samir Arora of Helios Capital suggests that the Indian stock market faces greater risk from a potential US economic downturn prompted by Trump's tariffs rather than direct tariffs on India. Arora underscores how US market instability could affect various sectors, including Indian IT, and investor trends.
title: Samir Arora warns! Biggest risk to Indian markets not Trump’s tariffs but…

description: Rajasthan Royals captain Sanju Samson is set to resume his wicketkeeping and captaincy roles after being cleared by the BCCI's Centre of Excellence. Previously limited to batting due to a fractured finger, Samson will lead the team in their next match against Punjab Kings on April 5.
title: Sanju Samson cleared by CoE to keep wickets; set to return as RR captain

description: Salman Khan's 'Sikandar' had a decent start at the box office, opening at Rs 26 crore. It saw growth on Eid with Rs 29 crore but dropped by 32% on day 3. Its total collection is Rs 75.49 crore.
title: 'Sikandar' box office collection: Salman Khan starrer expected to see a further drop

description: Chinese President Xi Jinping has unexpectedly swapped roles of Politburo members Li Ganjie and Shi Taifeng. This significant move, seen as part of Xi’s strategy to consolidate power ahead of the 2027 party congress, puts Li in charge of the United Front Work Department and Shi the Organisation Department, signaling Xi’s ongoing drive to eliminate rivals and reinforce loyalty.
title: Unprecedented CCP shake-up: Xi’s inner circle gets a jolt
'Unprovoked firing': Pak troops violate ceasefire, intrude into J&K's Poonch
'UPA-era was only to put stamp, we conduct discussions': Amit Shah on Waqf Bill
Waqf Bill showdown in Lok Sabha: Opposition's 4D attack on Centre

description: The BJP-led central government tabled the Waqf (Amendment) Bill in Parliament amid opposition from the INDIA bloc, incorporating suggestions from the Joint Parliamentary Committee. Union minister Kiren Rijiju defended the reforms, citing extensive consultations and emphasizing no interference in religious institutions, while Congress accused the Centre of rushing the legislation.
title: Waqf Bill to be named UMEED: Kiren Rijiju in LS

description: India's Test opener Yashasvi Jaiswal is moving from Mumbai to Goa for the 2025-26 domestic season, taking on the captaincy role. The 23-year-old, after a mixed performance in recent competitions, aims to rediscover his form and make an impact with his new team. Jaiswal follows a growing trend of Mumbai cricketers moving to Goa, a path previously taken by Arjun Tendulkar, Siddhesh Lad, and Eknath Kerkar in recent years.
title: What Yashasvi Jaiswal brings to the table for Goa after leaving Mumbai

description: Early diagnosis and intervention are crucial for managing Autistic Spectrum Disorder (ASD), improving cognitive and social-emotional functions in affected children. Despite no specific biomarker test available, observation of behaviour is essential. In India, challenges such as lack of acceptance, cultural differences, and high cost hinder early diagnosis. Multidisciplinary approaches and parental involvement are vital for effective management.
title: Why is early diagnosis of Autism still a challenge in India?

description: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to withdraw the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2024, stating that the amendments might harm the Muslim community's interests. Stalin argued the existing Waqf Act is sufficient and changes would weaken Waqf Boards and could affect religious autonomy and historical properties.
title: 'Will harm interests of Muslims': MK Stalin writes letter to PM Modi on Waqf Bill

description: Yashasvi Jaiswal, India’s Test opener, is making a significant shift from Mumbai to Goa for the 2025-26 season, where he will serve as captain. Despite his deep roots in Mumbai cricket, Jaiswal seeks a No-Objection Certificate to officially make the move.
title: Yashasvi Jaiswal to move to Goa from Mumbai

description: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy emphasized that advancement at the company is based on achieving more with fewer resources, not building large teams. Jassy highlighted Amazon's commitment to agility and meritocracy, stressing customer impact and reducing bureaucracy as key factors in success. He urged employees to act quickly and innovate.
title: Amazon CEO at Town Hall: The way to get ahead at Amazon is not to …

description: Val Kilmer, famous for his roles in 'Top Gun' and 'Batman Forever,' has died at 65. His daughter confirmed he died of pneumonia on April 1. Kilmer battled throat cancer for years. His major roles included Jim Morrison in 'The Doors' and Batman in 'Batman Forever.' He is survived by his two children, Mercedes and Jack.
title: Val Kilmer, iconic star of ‘Top Gun’ and ‘Batman Forever,’ passes away at 65

description: Three lawyers' bodies of Calcutta HC decided to boycott the swearing-in of Justice Dinesh Kumar Sharma, protesting his transfer from Delhi HC. They argued the transfer undermines the court's integrity due to allegations of impropriety against Justice Sharma.
title: 'Can’t be a dumping ground’: Now, Calcutta HC lawyers protest Delhi judge transfer

description: The US government recently suspended multiple research grants at Princeton University from agencies like the Department of Energy, Nasa, and the Defence Department. The suspension is amidst investigations into anti-semitism at Princeton. The university is one of many facing federal scrutiny over these issues. Princeton assures cooperation and defence of academic freedom.
title: 'Anti-semitism': Princeton becomes latest university to face US funding halt

description: Chief Minister M K Stalin requested a meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi to present a memorandum on delimitation from recent Joint Action Committee discussions. Stalin emphasized the significance of fair representation for citizens in parliamentary democracy and sought an audience along with select MPs from different parties to formally submit the concerns.
title: TN CM Stalin writes to PM Modi seeking appointment on delimitation issue

description: Self-styled preacher Bajinder Singh, originally convicted for murder and later converted to Christianity, has been sentenced to life imprisonment by a Punjab court for a 2018 rape case. Known for his claims of miraculous healing, Singh's ministry faced scrutiny after a 22-year-old woman accused him of sexual harassment, stalking, and criminal intimidation, leading to widespread controversy.
title: 'Badnaam hue to kia hua': Pastor converted to Christianity during jail term

description: The central government plans to table the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2024 in Parliament, amidst opposition resistance. The bill seeks to improve the administration of Waqf properties, introduce technology-driven management, address legal complexities, and ensure transparency and accountability in Waqf management while incorporating key reforms.
title: 15 FAQs to explain all you need to know on Waqf Bill

description: MNS criticized the Maharashtra govt for delays in constructing two flyovers on Kalyan Sheel Road, with prank banners featuring comedian Kunal Kamra. The project's slow pace since 2018 has caused major traffic jams. A political tussle ensued as local politicians from MNS and Shiv Sena traded barbs using the banners. Kamra faces FIR for remarks about Dy CM Shinde.
title: MNS targets Maharashtra govt over flyover delay with 'Kunal Kamra' banners

description: Evangelical Christian pastor Bajinder Singh has been sentenced to life imprisonment for raping a woman in 2018. He was also fined Rs 1 lakh. The court announced the punishment after convicting him. Singh previously served time for a murder case. The woman expressed satisfaction with the verdict. Other accused persons were acquitted due to insufficient evidence.
title: After pastor Bajinder Singh’s sentencing, rape survivor faints outside courtroom
Hyderabad youth rapes German tourist inside car, arrested

description: Eight members of the Banik family in South 24 Parganas died following a blast at their illegal fireworks factory. Two surviving family members, who ran the business, face serious charges. Investigations are ongoing to determine the cause and legality of the operations. Police plan stricter regulations for firework factories to prevent such tragedies in the future.
title: From 6 months to 80 years old, home cracker unit blast claims 8 of Bengal family
